title: [GAMEPLAY] Master Yi crits less than he should
body:
Almost a year ago, there was a post on Reddit demonstrating that Yi does not crit as often as he should. Specifically, the first hit of his double strike and the next hit after will almost never crit. The hit before double strike, the second hit of double strike itself, and his first three hits before double strike activates can all crit normally. I went into a custom game today and played around for about two hours with lots of different builds and situations.

In summary, building only zeals and crit cloaks to reach 100% crit chance, every hit was a crit. However, upon activating highlander with these same items, I noticed that my crits were significantly reduced. Furthermore, building a complete phantom dancer with 100% crit chance reduced the number of crits significantly as well. Finally, building a full static shiv with 100% crit chance reduced the number of crits, but not by as much as the phantom dancer.

Here is all the data that I gathered:

70% crit, no PD, no highlander
crits: 18
non-crits: 13
total: 58%

70% crit, with PD, highlander for 7s
crits: 23
non-crits: 28
total: 45%

90% crit, with shiv, no highlander
crits: 32
non-crits: 15
total: 68%

50% crit, no PD, no highlander
crits: 25
non-crits: 16
total: 60%

100% crit, no PD, no highlander
crits: 29
non-crits: 0
total: 100%

100% crit, no PD, highlander
crits: 10
non-crits: 7
total: 58%

note: only 50% crit chance during the 7s of highlander after first 3 hits

100% crit, PD, no highlander
crits: 23
non-crits: 17
total: 58%
note: first 3 hits always crit, 2nd ds hit and hit before ds always crit, 1st ds never crit, hit after ds only crit once
note: same result w/ highlander

100% crit, shiv, no highlander
crits: 15
non-crits: 3
total: 83%

100% crit, shiv, highlander
about 70% (forgot to record)

The video is a link to the raw footage I counted these numbers from.

First, 58 attacks is not a statistically significant sample size. So testing for crit rate at 70% or 50% crit chance like that is not really relevant. Though it can be an indicator.

What is relevant is 100% crit chance. Every time Yi swung his sword I saw orange text. So I don't know what you were seeing. He even got the bonus crit from his passive, though it was often expressed as the crit damage by itself and then the standard red text damage.

That being said, I feel if you crit, you should get nothing but orange text unless there is magic damage in there somewhere.

I don't think you know what statistically significant means. What you're complaining abut is a small sample size. While there is some complaint on that irl it hasn't stopped many published papers! 

Though, for our purposes it is enough to see that Yi isn't critting enough.

I attempted to replicate the instances where Master Yi {{champion:11}}  was not critting on every hit even with 100% crit chance. I found that when hitting bot champions and minions he crit every time with every build listed above both with and without highlander active. But when attacking neutral monsters some attacks were not critical strikes. First off I only noticed missing crits when highlander was active. I also always crit when I bought only Cloak of Agility {{item:1018}} , Brawler's Gloves {{item:1051}}  or Essence Reaver {{item:3508}}  to reach 100% crit chance even with highlander active. But I did have missing crits when I bought one or more Zeals {{item:3086}} , Rapid Fire Cannons {{item:3094}} , Statikk Shivs {{item:3087}} , Infinity Edges {{item:3031}} , Phantom Dancers {{item:3046}}  or Trinity Forces {{item:3078}} . I did not replicate the trials enough to accurately record the critical chance of each item build.
